intro: Phylica radiata, commonly known as the silver bush, is a South African shrub belonging to the Proteaceae family. It is characterized by its dense, silver-gray foliage and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, with a deep root system that allows it to survive in drought conditions. Its flowers attract a variety of pollinators, including bees and birds, contributing to local biodiversity. The plant is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
